subject: Re: [junit] Snow Leopard Install Help: Can't find tests
msgSnippet: ... Hi, Ted. I just checked and the class org.junit.tests.AllTests isn t part of the JUnit distribution JAR file. You can verify this yourself by listing the
messageBody:
On Sun, Mar 28, 2010 at 4:04 AM, ted_hogan <ted.hogan@...> wrote:

> I get the "Could not find class: org.junit.tests.AllTests" error when I test my JUnit install on Mac OS 10.6.2.
>
> Ant is installed via the xCode tools and functions properly. I am using the latest JUnit jar file.

Hi, Ted.

I just checked and the class "org.junit.tests.AllTests" isn't part of
the JUnit distribution JAR file. You can verify this yourself by
listing the contents of your junit.jar using "jar -tf junit.jar".

Instead, to get it you have to checkout the source from GitHub
(specifically, here:
http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/blob/master/src/test/java/org/junit/tests/AllTests.java).

- alistair
